showThenActions.description: Holds the current state of the Trigger GUI. Not used in runtime
Holds the current state of the Trigger GUI. Not used in runtime
Holds the current state of the Trigger GUI. Not used in runtime

active.description: Should action be active? Defaults to true.

collapsed.description: Should action be collapsed? Not used in runtime

active.description: Should action be active? Defaults to true.

collapsed.description: Should action be collapsed? Not used in runtime

active.description: Should action be active? Defaults to true.

collapsed.description: Should action be collapsed? Not used in runtime

active.description: Should action be active? Defaults to true.

collapsed.description: Should action be collapsed? Not used in runtime

waitMode.description: Synchronous: Next step will be called after last JavaScript line. Asynchronous: Next step will be called after calling ctx.success() or ctx.error(TcHmi.Errors.ERROR)

success.description: Steps which will be called after the call to ctx.success() with Asynchronous or after the last line with Synchronous.

error.description: Steps which will be called after the call to ctx.error() with Asynchronous or after an exception with Synchronous.

active.description: Should action be active? Defaults to true.

collapsed.description: Should action be collapsed? Not used in runtime

asyncWait.description: The next step is called after the completion of this step.

description.description: A long description of this control.

active.description: Should action be active? Defaults to true.

collapsed.description: Should action be collapsed? Not used in runtime

anyOf.title: ControlApiFunction
anyOf.description: Defines an API of the control.

active.description: Should action be active? Defaults to true.

collapsed.description: Should action be collapsed? Not used in runtime

active.description: Should action be active? Defaults to true.

collapsed.description: Should action be collapsed? Not used in runtime

anyOf.title: Comment
anyOf.description: Free comment. Will be ignored on runtime.

comment.description: Free comment. Will be ignored on runtime.

valueType.description: Information about the used type as a tchmi reference name for re-edit scenarios while Engineering.
Information about the expected type as a tchmi reference name.

controlSymbolExpression.title: controlSymbolExpression
controlSymbolExpression.description: Reference to a Control Symbol Expression

preventDefault.description:
If activated the default action of the event will not be triggered.
If set on touch events the corresponding mouse events will not be triggered.

displayName.description: Name which should be presented the user.

modules.description: List of modules like controls, functions and additional resources like Cascading Style Sheets or JavaScript files.

type.description: Describes a reference to a package.

nugetId.description: This is the NugetId of the referenced package. The resources of the referenced package are used before the rest of the modules.

basePath.description: The base path to find all control files.

descriptionFile.description: Name of the description file for the control: Description.json in most cases.

toolboxCategory.description: Defines the category in Engineering toolbox.

basePath.description: The base path to find the function <functionName>.js and <functionName>.function.json files.

descriptionFile.description: Name of the description file for the function. This is <functionName>.function.json in most cases. A path should be put into basePath.

type.description:
Defines we are refering to a (non-control and non-function) resource. This can be a CSS Stylesheet or a JS file. 
Javascript module files can be import'ed in controls and functions without referencing them here.

path.description:
Url of the css or js resource. 
Javascript module files can be import'ed in controls and functions without referencing them here.

theme.description: Restricts the CSS Resource to be used only for one specific theme name. Will be used for all themes if unset. (not valid for JS files)

component.description: Groups the resource for theme override in project. (not valid for JS files)

type.description: Defines we are refering to a language file.

locale.description: Determines the language code of the language file.

type.description: Defines we are refering to a *.usercontrol.
Defines we are refering to a *.content file.
Defines we are refering to a *.view file.

additionalProperties.description: Dictionary of category names. Key has to be a number.

uiProvider.description: This packages provides some system ui implementation.

type.description: This definition provides a system keyboard implementation.

name.description: Defines the id of this keyboard implementation. Use a namespace string to avoid name collisions.

projectBasedKeyboardFiles.description: Defines if the keyboard needs a list of keyboards in the project directory (will be stored in tchmiconfig.json)

projectBasedKeyboardFileExt.description: Defines the extension of keyboard files in the project.

type.description: This definition provides a system popup implementation.

name.description: Defines the id of this popup implementation. Use a namespace string to avoid name collisions.

popup.description: Defines the type of the popup. TODO: Needed?

internal.description: Definition of package based internal symbols (available via %i%Package:{PkgId};[SYMBOL_NAME]%/i%). Key is the symbol name.

additionalProperties.description: Definition of the internal symbol with this name.

persist.description: The change of value is saved in the client and available after reload. Defaults to false if not provided.

readonly.description: The symbol can not be changed. Defaults to false if not provided.

type.description: Information about the expected type as a tchmi reference name.

timer.description: Definition of package based based timer symbols (available via %t%Package:{PkgId};[SYMBOL_NAME]%/t%). Key is the symbol name.

additionalProperties.description: Definition of the timer symbol with this name.

pattern.description: Value pattern for this timer symbol.

value.description: Value for this pattern part. Only used when symbol is not defined.

duration.description: Duration in milliseconds for this timer symbol pattern part.

symbol.description: SymbolExpression which represents the value for this timer symbol pattern part. Overrides value when defined.

duration.description: Duration in milliseconds for this timer symbol pattern part.

runSymbol.description: SymbolExpression (Boolean) which controls the state of the timer.

stopValue.description: Value which is active when the timer is stopped.

type.description: Information about the expected type as a tchmi reference name.

package.description: Definition of package based symbols (available via %pkg%Package:{PkgId};[SYMBOL_NAME]%/pkg%) that can be mapped to other symbols at runtime. All symbol actions are forwared to the mapped symbol than. Key is the symbol name.

intervals.description: Definition of all package based intervals. Key is the interval name.

additionalProperties.description: Definition of the interval with this name.

actionTemplates.description: Definition of package based action templates.

esmoduleImports.description:
Allows mapping of an import keyword, path prefixes or full path to a real path inside this hmi package. 
See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/script/type/importmap

moduleScope.description:
Optional base path for this mapping. 
Can be used to restrict an entry to a single control.

imports.description:
Mapping of an import keyword, path prefixes or full path to a real path. 
See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/script/type/importmap

additionalProperties.description:
Path to map this import keyword, path prefixes or full path to. 
This path is relative to the package root (where this manifest is located).

dataTypes.description: List of data type schema definition files.

features.description: Provides information about supported features that will toggle specific support in the engineering when also supported by the used engineering version.
